page.title: 02Yearly rhythm,Upper Otter:1
page.content: We came to Upottery parish in Aug. 1984,when the valley was monopolised by the herds of black and white Frisians that were shepherded by car and dog twice daily through the lanes to the farm milking parlours.There were a few sheep in some of the fields and an occasional pig or two.Haymaking was over and second silage being cut,and on our walks we would come across great stacks of round bales,wrapped in black polythene in the corners of fields. As autumn advanced,the flocks of sheep grew bigger and by November most of the cattle were in sheds round the farms. Just a few were left out in sheltered spots,but,indoors or out,they were now being fed on silage and bought concentrates.
